story_25_03000/2401_1001_0200_10:
I played my hand for all it was worth, and yet...
here we are.
story_25_03000/2401_0401_0500_10:
This marks the second time I’ve seen that look on
your face. It’s not bad at all.
story_25_03000/2401_0401_0600_10:
I just wish it didn’t also mark the second time I’ve
lost to you.
story_25_03000/2401_0302_0700_10:
You and your team were really
tough, Grimsley.
story_25_03000/2401_0402_0800_10: Heh. Maybe, but a loss is a loss.
story_25_03000/2401_1001_0900_10:
The winner takes all, and there’s nothing left for
the loser.
story_25_03000/2401_1001_1000_10:
That’s the way of battle. I’m back to having
nothing left.
story_25_03000/2401_1001_1100_10: I won’t argue with that, Grimsley.
story_25_03000/2401_1001_1200_10:
But having lost doesn’t change what I...what we
aim to do.
story_25_03000/2401_1001_1300_10:
We’re going to keep fighting until we reach the
peak, no matter how many losses it takes.
story_25_03000/2401_1001_1400_10:
You’re coming with us, Grimsley. You wouldn’t
be satisfied with ending things on another loss,
would you?
story_25_03000/2401_1001_1500_10:
Besides, I haven’t quite had my fill of that thrilling
battle style of yours.
story_25_03000/2401_1001_1700_10:
Heh. I guess we’re all Trainers of a particularly
strange feather.
story_25_03000/2401_1001_1800_10:
Let’s get going. Losers like us don’t get to stick
around onstage.
story_25_03000/2401_1001_2000_10:
It looks like my visit to Alola might have to wait a
little while.
story_25_03000/2401_1001_2100_10: No problem. It’s a standing invitation.
